member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord
member.summary: Contains functionality for managing CBEFF records by ANSI INCITS 398-2008, ISO/IEC 19785 1:2006 with Amd. 1:2010, ISO/IEC 19785-3:2007 with Amd. 1:2010 and ISO/IEC 19785-3:2015 standards.
member.remarks: Support of standards cover as much as Neurotechnology supports concrete patron formats defined in these standards.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.PatronFormatIncitsTCM1BiometricsA
member.summary: The CBEFF patron format (owner and type) INCITS Technical Committee M1 - Biometrics Patron Format A.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.PatronFormatIncitsTCM1BiometricsB
member.summary: The CBEFF patron format (owner and type) INCITS Technical Committee M1 - Biometrics Patron Format B.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.PatronFormatNistD
member.summary: The CBEFF patron format (owner and type) NIST Patron Format D - NIST PIV.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.PatronFormatIsoIecJtc1SC37BiometricsSimpleByteOriented
member.summary: The CBEFF patron format (owner and type) ISO/IEC JTC 1 SC 37 - Biometrics Patron Format Simple byte oriented.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.PatronFormatIsoIecJtc1SC37BiometricsPresenceByteOriented
member.summary: The CBEFF patron format (owner and type) ISO/IEC JTC 1 SC 37 - Biometrics Patron Format Presence byte oriented.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.PatronFormatIsoIecJtc1SC37BiometricsTlvEncoded
member.summary: The CBEFF patron format (owner and type) ISO/IEC JTC 1 SC 37 - Biometrics Patron Format TLV-encoded.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.PatronFormatIsoIecJtc1SC37BiometricsComplex
member.summary: The CBEFF patron format (owner and type) ISO/IEC JTC 1 SC 37 - Biometrics Patron Format Complex.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.PatronFormatIsoIecJtc1SC37BiometricsComplexWithAddElem
member.summary: The CBEFF patron format (owner and type) ISO/IEC JTC 1 SC 37 - Biometrics Patron Format Complex with additional elements.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.FlagSkipDefaultValues
member.summary: The flag indicating whether to skip default values while serializing CbeffRecord. It will enforce skipping of those fields, which are defined as mandatory, but can be absent if default value applies, also optional fields, which have default value. The fields restrictions and possible default values are defined by concrete patron format.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.FlagTlvUseForOnCardMatching
member.summary: The flag indicating whether ISO/IEC JTC 1 SC 37 TLV-Encoded patron format record is used for on-card matching.
member.remarks: If flag is not set, it is considered that ISO/IEC JTC 1 SC 37 TLV-Encoded patron format record used for off-card matching (i.e. saved to memory record BIT BER-TLV data object will contain include private BDB (that is BDT BER-TLV data object).

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.FlagTlvAllowNonBerTlvBdbData
member.summary: The flag is supported only for FINGERPRINT biometric type and indicates whether BDB data buffer for ISO/IEC JTC 1 SC 37 TLV-Encoded patron format, can be encoded not in ISO/IEC 7816-4 BER-TLV format. In such case BDB data buffer shall be encoded as ISO/IEC 19794-2 compliant card compact / normal size minutiae series without any BER-TLV headers present.
member.remarks: If flag is set and minutiae series data is not found, then BDB data is stored as SCardTags.CardholderBiometricData BER-TLV value.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.FlagUseConfigurationData
member.summary: The flag indicating whether ISO/IEC JTC 1 SC 37 TLV-Encoded patron format record shall support Configuration Data BER-TLV data object (introduced since ISO/IEC 24787:2010 for on-card comparison only) within Biometric Information Template (BIT) BER-TLV data object.
member.remarks: If flag is not set, Configuration Data with tag SCardBitTags.ConfigurationData (if any) is simply ignored.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.PddeIsoIecJtc1SC37TlvEncodedAlgorithmReference
member.summary: Patron defined data element. ISO/IEC JTC 1 SC 37 TLV-encoded patron format owner defined data element "Algorithm reference".

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.PddeIsoIecJtc1SC37TlvEncodedReferenceDataQualifier
member.summary: Patron defined data element. ISO/IEC JTC 1 SC 37 TLV-encoded patron format owner defined data element "Reference data qualifier".

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.PddeIsoIecJtc1SC37TlvEncodedBiometricAlgorithmParameters
member.summary: Patron defined data element. ISO/IEC JTC 1 SC 37 TLV-encoded patron format owner defined data element "Biometric algorithm parameters".

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.AddeIsoIecJtc1SC37TlvEncodedBiometricConfigurationData
member.summary: Additionally defined data element. ISO/IEC JTC 1 SC 37 TLV-encoded patron format additional data element "Configuration data" introduced by ISO/IEC JTC 1 SC 17 in ISO/IEC 24787:2010.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.PddeNistFascn
member.summary: Patron defined data element. NIST Personal Identity Verification (PIV) patron format defined data element "FASC-N".

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.BiometricType
member.summary: Gets or sets CbeffRecord type.
member.remarks: This data element value is assigned by the Product Owner and represents the specific type of product as specified by the Product Owner. This value is specific to the product owner and can be registered using the same property as the BDB Format (BdbFormat).

member.summary: Gets or sets CbeffRecord subtype.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.ChallengeResponse
member.summary: Gets or sets the information used to formulate a particular challenge to the user of a biometric type.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.BdbCreationDate
member.summary: Gets or sets biometric data block (BDB) which is saved to CbeffRecord creation date.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.BdbIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets biometric data block (BDB) index.
member.value: NBuffer object containing BDB index value.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.ProductId
member.summary: Gets or sets product owner and type.
member.remarks:
Product Owner (e.g., the Biometric Service Provider (BSP) or Transforming Application) is that created or transformed the biometric data object. This data element uses the same format and registration method as the BDB Format Owner data element.
Product type is assigned by the Product Owner and represents the specific type of product as specified by the Product Owner. This value is specific to the product owner and can be registered using the same method as the BDB Format Type.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffRecord.Payload
member.summary: Gets or sets arbitrary data stored in the SBH for convenient association with the biometric information.

member.remarks: It could contain data (e.g., a person-identification-number) attached in a secure way to the BDB and used by a service system (e.g., access control system) in case that the biometric verification is positive.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffCompressionAlgorithmIdentifiers
member.summary: Specifies CBEFF Quality Algorithm Identifiers registered with International Biometric Industry Association (IBIA).

members.member: The CBEFF compression algorithm identifier assigned to INCITS Technical Committee M1 - Biometrics WSQ compressed fingerprint image IAFIS-IC-0010 (V3) - WSQ Gray-scale fingerprint image compression specification; 1997 algorithm.

The CBEFF compression algorithm identifier assigned to INCITS Technical Committee M1 - Biometrics ISO/IEC 10918 - Information Technology - Digital Compression and coding of continuous-tone still images (JPEG) algorithm.
The CBEFF compression algorithm identifier assigned to INCITS Technical Committee M1 - Biometrics ISO/IEC 15444 - Information Technology - JPEG 2000 Image Coding System algorithm.

The CBEFF compression algorithm identifier assigned to INCITS Technical Committee M1 - Biometrics ISO/IEC 15948:2003 Information technology -- Computer graphics and image processing -- Portable Network Graphics (PNG) algorithm.

member.summary: Specifies minutia ordering required by the card.

member.summary: Specifies than no ordering is required.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.FmcrMinutiaOrder.Ascending
member.summary: Specifies that minutiae are sorted ascending by the specified order.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.FmcrMinutiaOrder.Descending
member.summary: Specifies than minutiae are sorted descending by the specified order.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.FmcrMinutiaOrder.CartesianXY
member.summary: Specifies that minutiae are sorted by X coordinate. If X coordinates of two minutiae are equal Y coordinate is compared.

member.summary: Specifies that minutiae are sorted by Y coordinate. If Y coordinates of two minutiae are equal X coordinate is compared.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.FmcrMinutiaOrder.Polar
member.summary: Specifies than minutiae are sorted by distance from minutiae center of mass. If distance of two minutiae are equal minutia angle is compared.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.FMCRecord
member.summary: Provides functionality for loading, editing, saving and converting ISO/IEC 19794-2:2005 and ISO/IEC 19794-2:2011 card format standard templates (FMCRecords) to and/or from Neurotechnology Finger Records (NFRecords).

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.FMCRecord.MinutiaCollection
member.summary: Represents the collection of FmrMinutia.
member.remarks: The range of minutia angle is between 0 and 255 regardless of minutia format. For compact size minutia format, while serializing minutia's angle is converted to [0, 63] range. Also inserting minutia into minutiae list, for compact size minutia format the minutia angle is recalculated to adapt rounding inaccuracies between different angle ranges.

After changes to the minutiae list, the collections of minutia four/eight neighbors must be updated (if minutia neighbors are used). This can be done manually by resetting minutia neighbors or converting FMCRecord via NFRecord.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.FMCRecord.MinutiaFourNeighborsCollection
member.summary: Represents the collection of BdifFPMinutiaNeighbor.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.FMCRecord.MinutiaEightNeighborsCollection
member.summary: Represents the collection of BdifFPMinutiaNeighbor.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.FMCRecord.CoreCollection
member.summary: Represents the FmrCore collection.
member.remarks: The range of core angle is between 0 and 255 regardless of specified minutia format. This range also applies for serialized FMCRecord (it is not converted to [0,63] range as for minutia angle with compact size minutia format).

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.FMCRecord.DeltaCollection
member.summary: Represents the collection of the FmrDelta.
member.remarks: The range of delta angle is between 0 and 255 regardless of specified minutia format. This range also applies for serialized FMCRecord (it is not converted to [0,63] range as for minutia angle with compact size minutia format).

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.FMCRecord.FlagSkipAllExtendedData
member.summary: The flag indicating whether all extended data should be skipped while unpacking or packing FMCRecord. Extended data is all data except finger minutiae.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.FMCRecord.FlagUseBiometricDataTemplate
member.summary: The flag indicating whether FMCRecord should be packed as biometric data template (tag '7F2E') regardless of the containing data. The usage of this flag influences FMCRecord V3.0 serialization, when no extended data exists - by default it would be serialized as biometric data (tag '5F2E').

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.FMCRecord.FlagUseStandardBiometricDataObjects
member.summary: The flag indicating whether should be used standard biometric data objects (tag 'A1') while packing FMCRecord.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSegment
member.summary: This structure defines image segments for Type-20 and Type-21 records.
member.remarks: This structure is dedicated for Type-20 and Type-21 records for defining source or asscociated context image segments. Structure contains unique segment position, which can be referenced in other record types. This item is used in other biometric type records, which biometric's sample were derived from source file (then references to Record Type-20 segment) or to link with the context of the biometric data (references to Record Type-21 segment). The second item is internal file reference pointer, containing the reference to the particular instance, such as video frame, page, slide number, which were used in other record types to derive the images. If the file is single, the item value is set to 0.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSegment.NativeType
member.summary: Defines the native type of the object.

member.name: M:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSegment.#ctor(System.Byte,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes new instance of ANSegment structure.
member.param: Internal file reference pointer, containing the reference to the particular instance, such as video frame, page, slide number.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSegment.SegmentPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets segment position.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSegment.InternalFilePointer
member.summary: Gets or sets the internal file reference pointer.
member.value: Internal file reference pointer, containing the reference to the particular instance, such as video frame, page, slide number.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSourceContextRepresentation
member.summary: This structure defines source represantation/associated context, defining sample records links to source represantation record Type-20 or associated context record Type-21.
member.remarks: The first item contains representation number for concrete Type-20 record with the same source representation number or Type-21 record with the same associated context number. The second item defines record's segment index, which corresponds to segment position in Type-20 or Type-21 record's segment list.

member.summary: Defines the native type of the object.

member.param: Representation number to Type-20 record's source representation number or to Type-21 record's associated context number

member.value: >Representation number to Type-20 record's source representation number or to Type-21 record's associated context number.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSourceContextRepresentation.SegmentPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets segment position.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANTimeIndex
member.summary: This structure defines time index containing the start and end times of segments within a video or audio file for Type-20 and Type-21 records.
member.remarks: The first and second items contain time index start and end represented in ticks. Each of the item conforms to the "hh:mm:ss.sss" format.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANGeographicLocation
member.summary: This structure defines geographic sample acquisition location to specify location where biometric sample was collected.
member.remarks: 1st information item specifies coordinated universal time (UTC), when biometric data was collected. Information items from 2nd to 7th are optional as group and specifies geographic coordinate Latitude/Longitude. Latidute and longitude degrees are treated as pair and both are either present or absent. Latitude/Longitude minutes can be present only iftheir corresponding degree values are present. By analogy, the latitude/ longitude seconds can be only present if their corresponding minutes are present. Each of degree/minute/second value can be decimal or integer. If value is decimal then further adjusting items shall be not specified (must be set as '-1'). For example if latitude degree is 60.12564, then latitude minute and second shall be set '-1'. 8th information item is optional element elevation, specified in meters. If no elevation is given, then value must be set as '-1'. 9th and 10th information item specifies coordinate system, which was used for caldulating values for 2nd to 7th information items. Information items from 11th to 13th are optional as group and specifies location with a Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM)coordinate. 14th element is optional and specifies geographic reference text. Information items 15th and 16th should be used when alternate geographic coordinate system is used.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANGeographicLocation.NativeType
member.summary: Defines the native type of the object.
Initializes new instance of ANGeographicLocation structure.
member.param: Universal time entry, containing UTC value.
Other geodetic datum code, when geodeticDatumCode is defined as "other".
Geographic coordinate universal transverse Mercator zone.
Geographic coordinate universal transverse Mercator easting.
Geographic coordinate universal transverse Mercator northing.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANGeographicLocation.UniversalTimeEntry
member.summary: Gets or sets universal time entry, containing coordinated universal time (UTC) value.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANGeographicLocation.LatitudeDegree
member.summary: Gets or sets latitude degree.
member.remarks: Degree value can be decimal or integer. If value is decimal then further adjusting items shall be not specified (must be set as '-1'). For example if degree is 60.12564, then latitude minute and second shall be set '-1'.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANGeographicLocation.LatitudeMinute
member.summary: Gets or sets latitude minute.
member.remarks: Latitude minute can be only set, if latitude degrees is set. Minute value can be decimal or integer. If value is decimal then latitude second shall be not specified (set as '-1').

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANGeographicLocation.LatitudeSecond
member.summary: Gets or sets latitude second.
member.remarks: Latitude second can be only set, if latitude minute is set. Second value can be decimal or integer.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANGeographicLocation.LongitudeDegree
member.summary: Gets or sets longitude degree.
member.remarks: Degree value can be decimal or integer. If value is decimal then further adjusting items shall be not specified (must be set as '-1'). For example if degree is 60.12564, then latitude minute and second shall be set '-1'.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANGeographicLocation.LongitudeMinute
member.summary: Gets or sets longitude minute.
member.remarks: Latitude minute can be only set, if latitude degrees is set. Minute value can be decimal or integer. If value is decimal then longitude second shall be not specified (set as '-1').

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANGeographicLocation.LongitudeSecond
member.summary: Gets or sets longitude second.
member.remarks: Longitude second can be only set, if longitude minute is set. Second value can be decimal or integer.

member.summary: Gets or sets elevation in meters.

members.member: Defines SRC field number. Field referenced by this number contains the administration or organization that originally captured the latent image contained in the record. Normally, the Originating Agency Identifier, ORI, of the agency that captured the image.
Defines DAT field number. Field referenced by this number contains the date that the transaction was initiated.
Defines SUB field number. Field referenced by this number contains the image subject condition.
Defines CON field number. Field referenced by this number contains the capture organization name.
Defines ANN field number. Field referenced by this number contains the annotations, presenting operations performed on the original source.
Defines DUI field number. Field referenced by this number contains the device or source of the data.
Defines MMS field number. Field referenced by this number contains make, model and serial number for the image capture device.
Defines SAN field number. Field referenced by this number contains the source agency name of the agency referenced in Field 4.
Defines EFR field number. Field referenced by this number contains the external file reference if the data is not contained in Field 999.
Defines ASC field number. Field referenced by this number contains the associated context to one or more Record(s) Type-21.
Defines HAS field number. Field referenced by this number contains the hash value of the data in Field 999.
Defines SOR field number. Field referenced by this number contains the source representation to a representation(s) in Record(s) Type-20.
Defines GEO field number. Field referenced by this number contains the geographic sample acquisition location where sample was acquired (not where it is stored).
Specifies starting number from which user defined field starts.
Defines end number of user defined field starts.
Defines end number of user defined field starts for version 5.0 and above.
Defines minimal value length of field referenced by FieldSrc field number.
Defines minimal value length of field referenced by FieldSrc field number for version 5.0 and above.
Defines maximal value length of field referenced by FieldSrc field number.
Defines maximal value length of field referenced by FieldSrc field number for version 4.0 and above.
Defines code when quality score has not been calculated or provided for data contained in record object.
Defines code when quality assessment algorithm failed to asses record data quality.
Defines maximal quality score value for record data.
Defines minimal value length of field referenced by FieldSan field number.
Defines maximal value length of field referenced by FieldSan field number.
Defines minimal value length of field referenced by FieldCon field number.
Defines maximal value length of field referenced by FieldCon field number.
Defines minimal number value of field referenced by FieldAsc or FieldSor field numbers.
Defines maximal number value of field referenced by FieldSan or FieldSor field numbers.
Defines minimal segment position value of field referenced by FieldAsc or FieldSor field numbers.
Defines maximal segment position value of field referenced by FieldAsc or FieldSor field numbers.
Defines maximal value length of field referenced by FieldHas field number.
Defines minimal latitude degree value of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines maximal latitude degree value of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines minimal longitude degree value of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines maximal longitude degree value of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines minimal latitude/longitude minute value of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines maximal latitude/longitude minute value of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines minimal latitude/longitude second value of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines maximal latitude/longitude second value of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines minimal elevation value of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines maximal elevation value of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines maximal elevation value length of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines maximal elevation value length of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines default geographic coordinate system value for geodetic datum code of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines minimal UtmZone value length of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines maximal UtmZone value length of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines maximal UtmEasting value of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines maximal UtmNorthing value of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines maximal geographic reference text value length of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines maximal alternative geographic coordinate system identifier value of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines maximal alternative geographic coordinate system value value of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines maximal latitude degree value length of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines maximal longitude degree value length of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines maximal latitude/longitude minute value length of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines maximal latitude/longitude second value length of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines maximal elevation value length of field referenced by FieldGeo field number.
Defines minimal file type value length of field referenced by FieldSft or FieldAft fields number.
Defines maximal file type value length of field referenced by FieldSft or FieldAft fields number.
Defines maximal decoding instructions value length of field referenced by FieldSft or FieldAft fields number.
Defines minimal value length of field referenced by FieldEfr field number.
Defines maximal value length of field referenced by FieldEfr field number.
Defines minimal time index count of field referenced by FieldTix field number.
Defines maximal time index count of field referenced by FieldTix field number.
Defines maximal time index value length of field referenced by FieldTix field number.
Defines maximal time index hour value of field referenced by FieldTix field number.
Defines maximal time index minute value of field referenced by FieldTix field number.
Defines maximal time index second value of field referenced by FieldTix field number.
Defines maximal time index millisecond value of field referenced by FieldTix field number.
Defines minimal value length of field referenced by FieldIcdr field number.
Defines minimal value length of field referenced by FieldIcdr field number for version 5.1.
Defines maximal value length of field referenced by FieldIcdr field number.

member.summary: Describes NIST Fingerprint Image Quality (NFIQ) scores.
member.remarks:
Position field represents fingerprint/palmprint position. Score field represent quality assessment which has been calculated using scoring algorithm. AlgorithmVendorId field represents ID of the vendor of the quality algorithm used to calculate the quality score. AlgorithmProductId field represents numeric product code assigned by the vendor
of the quality algorithm.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFPrintPosition
member.summary: Describes print position coordinates.
member.remarks:
Structure consist of six (6) mandatory information items to describe the type or portion of the latent image contained in this record and its location within an entire joint image.
The first information item is the number of the full finger view with values of "FV1" through "FV4". Values of “FV1” to “FV4” specify the bounding coordinates for each full finger view.
The second information item is used to identify the location of a segment within a full finger view. It contain the not applicable code “NA” if the image portion refers to a full finger view or to the entire joint image locations. It contains “PRX”, “DST”, “MED” for a proximal, distal, or medial
segment.
The next four information items are the horizontal and vertical offsets relative to the
origin positioned in the upper left corner of the image. The horizontal offsets (X) are the pixel
counts to the right, and the vertical offsets (Y) are the pixel counts down. The location of the
image portion is defined by the sequence of X coordinates (LEFT, RIGHT) and the Y coordinates (TOP, BOTTOM), of its bounding box. For the case of a fingertip, the first information item shall be “TIP”, and the second information item shall be “NA”.
The next four information items are the horizontal and vertical offsets as defined above.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFAmputation
member.summary: Defines amputated or injured finger/hand.
member.remarks:
Structure contains two information items. The first item is the finger/palm number. The second item is the amputated or bandaged code (AMPCD). Allowable indicators for the AMPCD are listed bellow:
* Amputation - XX * Unable to print (e.g., bandaged) - UP. * Scar (e.g., bandaged) - SR.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFSegment
member.summary: Defines image segments containing individual fingers.
member.remarks: This structure contains offsets to the locations of image segments containing the individual fingers within the flat images of the four simultaneous fingers from each hand or the two simultaneous thumbs. The offsets are relative to the origin positioned in the upper left corner of the image. The horizontal offsets (X) are the pixel counts to the right, and the vertical offsets (Y) are the pixel counts down. A finger segment is defined by the finger number, which is between one and ten , the X coordinates (LEFT, RIGHT) and the Y coordinates (TOP, BOTTOM), of its bounding box.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology
member.summary: Describes friction ridge capture technology.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.Unknown
member.summary: Indicates unknown friction ridge capture technology.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.Other
member.summary: Indicates capture technology which can not be characterized by other values.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.ScannedInkOnPaper
member.summary: Indicates ink applied to friction ridge skin and then applied to paper.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.OpticalTirBrightField
member.summary: Indicates capture technology when that contact livescan device captures ridge information such that ridges absorb light, and absence of ridges reflects light back to the sensor (dark ridges on a white background).

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.OpticalTirDarkField
member.summary: Indicates capture technology when that contact livescan device captures ridge information such that ridges reflect light, and absence of ridges absorb light (white ridges on a dark background).

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.OpticalDirectImagingNative
member.summary: Indicates light reflected from the friction ridge is imaged, resulting in a light gray on darker gray image.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.OpticalDirectImagingLowFrequency
member.summary: Indicates light reflected from the friction ridge is imaged onto one or more sensors and utilizes the low frequency 3D detail to project the image texture onto a 2D grayscale image.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.Imaging3DHighFrequency
member.summary: Indicates that high frequency friction ridge information is collected and then “unwrapped” to create a 2D image from the 3D point cloud or mesh.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.Capacitive
member.summary: Indicates capture technology when the capacitance of the friction ridge skin is assessed via a conducted AC signal.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.CapacitiveRF
member.summary: Indicates capture technology when the capacitance of the friction ridge skin is assessed via a conducted RF signal.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.OpticalDirectImagingElectroLuminescent
member.summary: Indicates capture technology when the ridges and an alternating current (AC) signal cause an EL panel to emit light which is captured by an imaging system.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.ReflectedUltrasonicImage
member.summary: Indicates when the friction ridge reflects ultrasonic energy which is assessed by the sensor.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.UltrasonicImpediography
member.summary: Indicates when absorption of ultrasonic energy is measured by changes in the impedance of a piezo-electric material.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.ThermalImaging
member.summary: Indicates when sensor measures the heat reflected from the friction ridge skin in contact with the sensor.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.DirectPressureSensitive
member.summary: Indicates when pressure of the fingerprint ridge skin against a material is measured.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.IndirectPressure
member.summary: Indicates when pressure of the fingerprint ridge skin against a deformable material is assessed optically to produce a friction ridge image.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.LiveTape
member.summary: Indicates when tape is used on friction ridge skin to collect friction ridge detail and the tape is then imaged by traditional photography.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.LatentImpression
member.summary: Indicates when the digital image of the latent impression is acquired directly from the latent impression, using a scanner or digital camera.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.LatentPhoto
member.summary: Indicates when physical photograph of the latent impression is scanned using a flatbed scanner or digital camera.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.LatentMoldedImpression
member.summary: Indicates when a mold / cast is taken from a latent friction ridge and then a “duplicate” is generated from moldable / printable material and imaged.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.LatentTracing
member.summary: Indicates older legacy latent friction ridge capture process in which a hand-drawn or computer-drawn tracing would subsequently be imaged by a flatbed scanner or photographed.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.LatentLift
member.summary: Indicates when chemical is applied to a latent friction ridge print, subsequently transparent tape is applied to lift the print from the latent surface, and the tape is then placed on paper to be imaged.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFRCaptureTechnology.Unspecified
member.summary: Indicates unspecified capture technology.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFPImageAsciiBinaryRecord
member.summary: Provides basic functionality for ANType13Record, ANFPImageAsciiBinaryRecord and ANType15Record logical records.

member.summary: Represent collection of fingerprint positions.

member.summary: Represent collection of amputations.

member.summary: Represent collection of segments.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFPImageAsciiBinaryRecord.QualityMetricCollection
member.summary: Represent collection of fingerprint quality metrics.

members.member: Defines IMP field number. Field referenced by this number indicates the manner by which the latent image information was obtained.
Defines FGP field number. Field referenced by this number contains one or more possible finger or palm positions that may match the latent image.
Defines PD field number. Field referenced by this number is used to narrow the search of the latent image in this record against a database.
Defined PPC field number. Field referenced by this number contains offsets to the locations for the bounding box of the EJI, each of the full finger views, or segments within the EJI.
Defines AMP field number. Field referenced by this number specifies if one or more fingers or hand are amputated or bandaged (AMP).
Defines SEG field number. Field referenced by this number specifies alternate approach to describing the locations for each of the image segments of the individual fingers within a flat image.
Defined FCT field number. Field referenced by this number contains friction ridge capture technology.
Defines maximum number of finger or palm position (FGP) in one record.
Defines maximum number of Print Position Coordinates (PPC).

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANDeviceMonitoringMode
member.summary: This enumeration contain information describing the level of human monitoring for the image capture device. Table "Device monitoring modes" describes each enumeration value.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANDeviceMonitoringMode.Unspecified
member.summary: Monitoring level unspecified.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANDeviceMonitoringMode.Controlled
member.summary: Operator physically controls the subject to acquire biometric sample.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANDeviceMonitoringMode.Assisted
member.summary: Person available to provide assistance to subject submitting the biometric.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANDeviceMonitoringMode.Observed
member.summary: Person present to observe operation of the device but provides no assistance.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANDeviceMonitoringMode.Unattended
member.summary: No one present to observe or provide assistance.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANDeviceMonitoringMode.Unknown
member.summary: No information is known.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANBoundaryCode
member.summary: This enumeration defines type of boundary defining a region in image.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANBoundaryCode.Unspecified
member.summary: Boundary code is unspecified.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANBoundaryCode.Circle
member.summary: The boundary is circle and it is defined by 2 points: the center and any point on the circle.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANBoundaryCode.Ellipse
member.summary: The boundary is ellipse with 3 points: both endpoints of one of the ellipse's axes and one endpoint from the other axis.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANBoundaryCode.Polygon
member.summary: The boundary is polygon and it is defined as as a n-vertex, where 'n' is between 3 and 99.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANOcclusionOpacity
member.summary: This enumeration defines occlusion opacity.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANOcclusionOpacity.Total
member.summary: Image contains occlusion wirth no detail in the area of the occlusion.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANOcclusionOpacity.Interference
member.summary: Occlusion contains interfering texture such as eyelashes, hair etc.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANOcclusionOpacity.PartialLight
member.summary: Image contains occlusion area that is lighter than the rest of the face or iris.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANOcclusionOpacity.PartialShadow
member.summary: Image contains occlusion area that is darker than the rest of the face or iris.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANOcclusionType
member.summary: This enumeration defines type of occlusion.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANOcclusionType.Lashes
member.summary: Eyelashes or reflections of eyelashes. Suitable only for iris image type.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANOcclusionType.HeadCovering
member.summary: Various head coverings, such as hat, hair, burka etc. Suitable only for face image type.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANOcclusionType.Specular
member.summary: Specularity, reflection of light.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANOcclusionType.Shadow
member.summary: Shadow.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANOcclusionType.Reflection
member.summary: Reflection of an object.

members.member: Defines HLL field number. Field referenced by this number contain the number of pixels contained on a single horizontal line of the transmitted image (horizontal line length - HLL).
Defines VLL field number. Field referenced by this number contains contains vertical line length (VLL), the number of horizontal lines contained in the transmitted image.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANImageAsciiBinaryRecord.FieldSlc
member.paraattr: Defines SLC field number. Field referenced by this number contains scale units (SLC) - the units used to describe the image sampling frequency (pixel density).

members.member: Defines HPS field number. Field referenced by this number contains horizontal pixel scale (HPS), the integer pixel density used in the horizontal direction of the transmitted image.
Defines VPS field number. Field referenced by this number contains vertical pixel scale (VPS), the integer pixel density used in the vertical direction of the transmitted image.
Defines CGA field number. Field referenced by this number specifies compression algorithm (CGA), the algorithm used to compress the transmitted grayscale images.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANImageAsciiBinaryRecord.FieldBpx
member.paraattr: Defines BPX field number. Field referenced by this number contains bits per pixel (BPX), the number of bits used to represent a pixel.

Defines SVPS field number. Field referenced by this number contains scanned vertical pixel scale (SVPS), the vertical pixel density used for the scanning of the original impression.
Defines COM field number. Field referenced by this number contains comments or other ASCII text information with the image data

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANValidationLevel
member.summary: Defines validation level of ANTemplate/ANRecord according to ANTemplate standard versions.
member.remarks:
If Validation level of ANTemplate/ANRecord is anvlStandard, then user can use high level API functions for record content management. ANRecord can be validated to check that all mandatory fields are presented and fit together.
If Validation level of ANTemplate/ANRecord is anvlminimal, then user can use low level API functions to manipulate records fields values. ANRecords is not validated in this case. User can remove mandatory fields or add fields to records in ANTemplate as wanted.
If MegaMatcher product is used all records will be validated using anvlStandard validation level.
If VeriFinger product is used following records would be validated using anvlStandard validation level: ANType3Record, ANType4Record, ANType5Record, ANType6Record, ANType9Record.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANValidationLevel.Minimal
member.summary: Validation level anvlMinimal means that user can use low level API functions to manipulate records fields values.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANValidationLevel.Standard
member.summary: Validation level anvlStandard means that user can use high level API functions for record content management.

members.member: This ANTemplate version implements "Data Format for the Interchange of Fingerprint Information" standard (ANSI/NIST-CSL 1-1993) format.
This ANTemplate version implements "Data Format for the Interchange of Fingerprint Information" standard (ANSI/NIST-ITL 1a-1997) format.
This ANTemplate version implements "Data Format for the Interchange of Fingerprint, Facial, & Scar Mark & Tattoo (SMT) Information” that carried the ANSI designation of ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2000
This ANTemplate version implements version of the standard that carried the ANSI designation of (ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2007).
This ANTemplate version implements version of the standard that carried the ANSI designation of ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2011.
This ANTemplate version implements version of the standard that carried the ANSI designation of ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2011 Update 2013 Edition 2.
This ANTemplate version implemets version of the standard that carried the ANSI designation of ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2011 Update 2015.
Defines the current version of standard that ANTemplate library implements. Current version is Version52 (ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2011 Update 2015).

member.summary: Enumerates SMT descriptor code values.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSmtSource.Scar
member.summary: This value indicates healed scar tissue that was the result of an accident or a medical procedure.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSmtSource.Mark
member.summary: This value is used for the pattern resulting from needle or track marks.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSmtSource.Tattoo
member.summary: This field indicates a common tattoo or indelible image resulting from the pricking of the skin with a coloring matter.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSmtSource.Chemical
member.summary: Indicates if the image was created by the use of chemicals to burn the image into the skin.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSmtSource.Branded
member.summary: Indicates if the tattoo image was burned into the skin using a branding iron or other form of heat.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSmtSource.Cut
member.summary: Indicates if the tattoo image was caused by incision of the skin.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSmtSource.Piersing
member.summary: Indicates medical or quasi-medically induced hole in or through the skin.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSmtSource.Birthmark
member.summary: Indicates birthmark, which is not the result of an accident or medical procedure.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSmtSource.Zabiba
member.summary: Indicates a 'prayer bump' on the forehead.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSmtSource.Implant
member.summary: Indicates Sub-dermal implants that are visible as distinct shapes in the skin.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType10Record
member.summary:
Provides functions for working with Type-10 Facial & SMT image record.
Type-10 tagged-field image records are used to exchange facial and image data from scars, marks, and tattoos (SMT) together with textual information pertinent to the digitized image. The source of the image data is the image captured from scanning a photograph, a live image captured with a digital camera, or a digitized "freeze-frame" from a video camera.

members.member: Defines IMT field number. Field referenced by this number contains Image type (IMT) which is used to indicate the type of image contained in this record.
Defines PHD field number. Field referenced by this number contains photo date (PHD) value which contains the date that the facial or SMT image contained in the record was captured.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType10Record.FieldCsp
member.paraattr: Defines CSP field number. Field referenced by this number contains color space (CSP) value used to identify the color space used to exchange the image data.

members.member: Defines SAP field number. Field referenced by this number contains subject acquisition profile (SAP). Intent of this field is to provide a general description of the criteria under which the facial image was captured.

Defines FIP field number. Field referenced by this number contains face image bounding box coordinates to indicate the face of interest or it can be used for cropping the single facial image. This field is an alternatetive to the field referenced by FieldFpfi.

Defines FPFI field number. Field referenced by this number contains face image path coordinates to indicate offset(s) to the location of the path defining a region of face. This field is an alternatetive to the field referenced by FieldFip.
Defines DIST field number. Field referenced by this number contains distortion.
Defines LAF field number. Field referenced by this number contains lighting artifacts, found in face images.
Defines POS field number. Field referenced by this number contains subject pose (POS) value.
Defines POA field number. Field referenced by this number contains pose offset angle.
Defines PXS field number. Field referenced by this number contains photo description (PXS) that describes special attributes of the captured facial image
Defines PAS field number. Field referenced by this number contains photo acquisition source (PAS) value which specifies the classification of the source of the image contained in record.
Defines SQS field number. Field referenced by this number contains subject quality score (SQS) which specifies quality score data for facial images stored in this record.
Defines SPA field number. Field referenced by this number contains subject pose angles.

Defines SXS field number. Field referenced by this number contains subject facial description (SXS) which describes the facial expression of the subject and other attributes associated with the subject's captured facial image.
Defines SEC field number. Field referenced by this number contains subject eye color (SEC) value.
Defines SHC field number. Field referenced by this number contains subject hair color value.
Defines FFP field number. Field referenced by this number contains facial feature points (FFP) used to exchange of facial image data.
Defines TMC field number. Field referenced by this number contains tiered markup collection to specify 2D facial feature points referenced by FieldFfp.
Defines 3DF field number. Field referenced by this number contains 3D facial feature points used to exchange of facial image data.
Defines FEC field number. Field referenced by this number contains feature contours tos define specific countour of the image.
Defines ICDR field number. Field referenced by this number contains the image capture date range estimate.
Defines COM field number. Field referenced by this number contains comments or other Unicode text information with the image data.
Defines T10 field number. Field referenced by this number contains type-10 reference number used to relate different Type-10 records of the same SMT or body part.

Defines SMT field number. Field referenced by this number contains NCIC designation code (SMT) which is used to identify a general location of the captured scar, mark, tattoo, or other characteristic (including piercings) in image.
Defines SMS field number. Field referenced by this number contains SMT size (SMS) value which contains the dimensions of the scar, mark or tattoo.
Defines SMD field number. Field referenced by this number contains SMT descriptors (SMD) which is used to describe the content of the SMT image.
Defines COL field number. Field referenced by this number contains Color value.
Defines ITX field number. Field referenced by this number contains image transformations.
Defines OCC field number. Field referenced by this number contains occlusions which partially or tottally blocks face in the image.
Defines PID field number. Field referenced by this number contains suspected patterned injury details.
Defines CID field number. Field referenced by this number contains cheiloscopic image data. This field may be used when image type is "Lip".
Defines VID field number. Field referenced by this number contains dental visual image data information. This field may be used when image type is "ExtraOral" or "IntraOral".
Defines RSP field number. Field referenced by this number contains ruler or scale which are present in the image.
Defines T2C field number. Field referenced by this number contains type-2 Record cross reference, which are IDC value of related Type-2 record .
Defines that the Subject Acquisition Profile (SAP) is unknown.
Defines Surveillance facial image for the Subject Acquisition Profile (SAP).
Defines driver's license image for the Subject Acquisition Profile (SAP).
Defines ANSI full frontal facial image for the Subject Acquisition Profile (SAP).
Defines ANSI token facial image for the Subject Acquisition Profile (SAP).
Defines ISO full frontal face image.
Defines ISO token face image.
Defines PIV facial image (NIST SP 800-76) for the Subject Acquisition Profile (SAP).
Defines legacy mugshot value for the Subject Acquisition Profile (SAP).
Defines Best Practice Application - Level 30 value for the Subject Acquisition Profile (SAP)
Defines Best Practice Application - Level 32 value for the Subject Acquisition Profile (SAP)
Defines Best Practice Application - Level 40 value for the Subject Acquisition Profile (SAP).
Defines Best Practice Application - Level 42 value for the Subject Acquisition Profile (SAP).
Defines Best Practice Application - Level 50 value for the Subject Acquisition Profile (SAP).
Defines Best Practice Application - Level 51 value for the Subject Acquisition Profile (SAP).
Defines Best Practice Application - Level 52 value for the Subject Acquisition Profile (SAP).
Defines maximum number of photo description attributes.
Defines maximum number of quality metric.
Maximum subject facial description count.
Defines maximum NCIC designation code (SMT) count value.
Maximum number of the NCIC designation codes (SMT).
Maximum number of the Tattoo color (COL) for version 5.0 and above.
Defines maximum number of facial features count.
Defines maximum number of 3D facial features count.
Defines maximum physical photo characteristic length.
Defines other maximum physical photo characteristic length.
Defines minimum subject facial characteristic length.
Maximum subject facial characteristic length.
Defines maximum photo acquisition source value.
Defines maximum photo acquisition source value for version 5.0 and above.
Defines minimum NCIC designation code (SMT) count value.
Defines maximum NCIC designation code (SMT) length
Maximum size of the field referenced by field number FieldSmt
Maximum size of the field referenced by field number FieldSmt for version 5.0 and above.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANNistQualityMetric
member.summary: Represents NIST Fingerprint Image Quality (NFIQ) scores.
member.remarks:
Structure contains two information items . The first item is the finger number between one and ten.
The second item is the quality score which is a quantitative expression of the predicted AFIS matcher accuracy performance of the fingerprint image. The scores range from "1" for the best quality image, to "5" for the worst quality image. A "254" indicates that no score was ever computed while an entry of "255" shall indicate a failed attempt to calculate the image quality metric.

member.summary: Initializes new instance of ANNistQualityMetric structure.
member.param: One of BdifFPPosition values representing fingerprint position code.
Quality score which is a quantitative expression of the predicted AFIS matcher accuracy performance of the fingerprint image.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType17Record.FieldRae
member.paraattr: Defines RAE field number. Field referenced by this number contains the rotation angle of the eye.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType17Record.FieldRau
member.paraattr: Defines RAU field number. Field referenced by this number contains the rotation uncertainty.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType17Record.FieldIpc
member.paraattr: Defines IPC field number. Field referenced by this number contains image property code.

members.member: Defines DUI field number. Field referenced by this number contains id of the device or source of the data.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType17Record.FieldGui
member.paraattr: Defines GUI field number. Field referenced by this number contains globally unique identifier.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType17Record.FieldMms
member.paraattr: Defines MMS field number. Field referenced by this number contains make, model and serial number for the iris capture device.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType17Record.FieldEcl
member.paraattr: Defines ECL field number. Field referenced by this number contains the subject's eye color.

members.member: Is used to insert comments or other ASCII text information with the image data.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType17Record.FieldShps
member.paraattr: Defines SHPS field number. Field referenced by this number contains scanned horizontal pixel scale (SHPS) - the horizontal pixel density used for the scanning of the original impression providing the SLC field.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType17Record.FieldSvps
member.paraattr: Defines SVPS field number. Field referenced by this number contains scanned vertical pixel scale (SVPS) - the vertical pixel density used for the scanning of the original impression providing the SLC field.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType17Record.FieldIqs
member.paraattr: Defines IQS field number. Field referenced by this number contains a quality score data for the iris image stored in this record.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType17Record.FieldAls
member.paraattr: Defines ALS field number. Field referenced by this number contains the lighting spectrum used in capturing the iris image.

members.member: Defines IRD field number. Field referenced by this number contains the expected iris diameter in pixels.
Defines SSV field number. Field referenced by this number contains specified spectrum values with lower and upper bounds.
Defines DME field number. Field referenced by this number contains information if eye is damaged or missing. If eyey is missing or unable to capture, the image data may be absent.
Defines IAP field number. Field referenced by this number contains subject acquisition profile for iris.
Defines ISF field number. Field referenced by this number contains iris storage format.
Defines IPB field number. Field referenced by this number contains iris pupillary boundary, between the iris and pupil.
Defines ISB field number. Field referenced by this number contains iris limbic boundary, between the iris and sclera.
Defines UEB field number. Field referenced by this number contains boundary, between upper eyelid and the eye.
Defines LEB field number. Field referenced by this number contains boundary, between lower eyelid and the eye.
Defines NEO field number. Field referenced by this number contains non-eyelid occlusions.
Defines RAN field number. Field referenced by this number contains estimated distance from the lens of the camera to the iris. distance is measured in centimeters.

Defines GAZ field number. Field referenced by this number contains angle in degrees between optical axis of the eye and line connecting the optical center of the eye and the optical center of the camera.
Maximum iris diameter in pixels.
Minimal iris diameter in pixels for version 5.0 and above.
Maximum number of the Image Quality Score (IQS).
Maximum number of the Image Quality Score (IQS) for version 5.0 and above.
Defines minimum spectrum lower bound value for Specified Spectrum Values field referenced by field number FieldSsv.
Defines maximum spectrum lower bound value for Specified Spectrum Values field referenced by field number FieldSsv.
Defines minimum spectrum upper bound value for Specified Spectrum Values field referenced by field number FieldSsv.
Defines maximum spectrum upper bound value for Specified Spectrum Values field referenced by field number FieldSsv.
Defines Level 20 value for the Subject Acquisition Profile for iris (IAP).
Defines Level 30 value for the Subject Acquisition Profile for iris (IAP).
Defines Level 40 value for the Subject Acquisition Profile for iris (IAP).
Defines minimal number of iris pupil vertices referenced by field number FieldIpb.
Defines maximal number of iris pupil vertices referenced by field number FieldIpb.
Defines minimal number of iris sclera vertices referenced by field number FieldIsb.
Defines maximal number of iris sclera vertices referenced by field number FieldIsb.
Defines minimal number of eyelid vertices referenced by field numbers FieldUeb or FieldLeb.
Defines maximal number of eyelid vertices referenced by field numbers FieldUeb or FieldLeb.
Defines minimal number of occlusions referenced by field numbers FieldNeo.
Defines maximal number of occlusions referenced by field numbers FieldNeo.
Defines minimum range value for field referenced by field number FieldRan.
Defines maximum range value for field referenced by field number FieldRan.
Defines maximum frontal gaze angle value for field referenced by field number FieldGaz.

summary.paraattr: Provides functions for managing Type-1 Transaction information record. A Type-1 logical record is mandatory and is required for each transaction. The Type-1 record provides information describing type and use or purpose for the transaction involved, a listing of each logical record included in the file, the originator or source of the physical record, and other useful and required information items.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.CharsetCollection
member.summary: Represent collection of character sets.

member.summary: Adds character set to CharsetCollection with specified name, \version.
member.returns: Number of character sets in CharsetCollection.

member.summary: Adds character set to CharsetCollection with specified name, version. and index.

member.summary: Check if character set specified by charsetIndex is in CharsetCollection
member.returns: true if character set is in CharsetCollection otherwise false.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.FieldVer
member.paraattr: Defines VER field number. Field referenced by this number contains the current version number of the standard implemented by the software.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.FieldCnt
member.paraattr: Defines CNT field number. Field referenced by this number contains file content (CNT). This mandatory field shall list and identify each of the logical records in the file by record type. It also specifies the order in which the remaining logical records shall appear in the file.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.FieldTot
member.paraattr: Defines TOT field number. Field referenced by this number contains type of transaction (TOT). This mandatory field shall contain an identifier, which designates the type of transaction and subsequent processing that this file should be given.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.FieldDat
member.paraattr: Defines DAI field number. Field referenced by this number contains the date that the transaction was initiated.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.FieldPry
member.paraattr: Defines PRY field number. Field referenced by this number contains priority (PRY). This optional field shall contain a single information character to designate the urgency with which a response is desired.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.FieldDai
member.paraattr: Defines DAI field number. Field referenced by this number contains destination agency identifier, the administration or organization designated to receive the transmission.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.FieldOri
member.paraattr: Defines ORI field number. Field referenced by this number contains originating agency identifier (ORI). This mandatory field shall contain the identifier of the administration or organization originating the transaction.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.FieldTcn
member.paraattr: Defines TCN field number. Field referenced by this number contains transaction control number (TCN). This mandatory field shall contain the Transaction Control Number as assigned by the originating agency.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.FieldTcr
member.paraattr: Defines TCR field number. Field referenced by this number contains transaction control reference (TCR). This optional field shall be used for responses that refer to the TCN of a previous transaction involving an inquiry or other action that required a response.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.FieldNsr
member.paraattr: Defines NSR field number. Field referenced by this number contains native scanning resolution.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.FieldNtr
member.paraattr: Defines NTR field number. Field referenced by this number contains native transmitting resolution.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.FieldDom
member.paraattr: Defines DOM field number. Field referenced by this number contains domain name. This optional field identifies the domain name for the user-defined Type-2 logical record implementation.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.FieldGmt
member.paraattr: Defines GMT field number. Field referenced by this number contains Greenwich mean time.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.FieldDcs
member.paraattr: Defines DCS field number. Field referenced by this number contains directory of character sets.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.FieldAps
member.paraattr: Defines APS field number. Field referenced by this number contains application profile specifications.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.FieldAnm
member.paraattr: Defines ANM field number. Field referenced by this number contains destination and originating agency names.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.FieldGns
member.paraattr: Defines GNS field number. Field referenced by this number contains geographic name set.

members.member: Defines 7-bit Ascii characters set.
Defines 8-bit Ascii Latin characters set.
Defines 16-bit Unicode characters set, used up to the version 4.0 of the standard.
Defines 16-bit Unicode characters set, used from the version 4.0 of the standard.
Defines 8-bit UTF-8 characters set.
Defines 32-bit UTF-32 characters set.
User defined character set. Character set index starts at 128.
User defined character set. Character set index ends at 999.
Defines maximal resolution value for NSR and NTR.
Defines maximal resolution value for NSR and NTR for version 4.0 of the standard.
Defines minimal resolution value for NSR and NTR for version 5.0 and upper of the standard.
Defines minimal Minimal scanning resolution which is 19.60 pixel points per millimeter.
Defines minimal Native scanning resolution (NSR).
Defines minimal Native scanning resolution (NSR) for version 5.0 and upper of the standard.
Defines maximal Native scanning resolution (NSR) for version 5.0.
Defines minimal Nominal resolution (NTR) for version 5.0 and upper of the standard.
Defines maximal Nominal resolution (NTR) for version 5.0 and upper of the standard.
Defines minimal transmitting resolution for low-resolution records.
Defines maximal transmitting resolution for low-resolution records.
Defines minimal transmitting resolution for high-resolution records.
Defines maximal transmitting resolution for high-resolution records.
Defines minimal length of transaction type field value.
Defines maximal length of transaction type field value.
Defines minimal length of transaction type field value starting from version 5.0.
Defines maximal length of transaction type field value. starting from version 5.0.
Defines maximal charset set count of field referenced by FieldDcs field number.
Defines the urgency with which a response is desired. Earlier standard defined that priority values would be from 1 to 4. Lower numbers representing higher priority.
Defines the urgency with which a response is desired. Current standard defines priority values from 1 to 9. Lower numbers represents higher priority.
Defines maximal application profile specifivcation count of field referenced by FieldAps field number.
Defines unknown type of transaction for field referenced by FieldTot field number.
Defines unknown destination agency identifier for field referenced by FieldDai field number.
Defines unknown originating agency identifier for field referenced by FieldOri field number.
Defines unknown transaction control number for field referenced by FieldTcn field number.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.NativeScanningResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets native scanning resolution.
member.value: Number containing native scanning resolution in pixels per millimeter x 1000. For Antemplate.Version50 images with scanning resolution greater than or equal to the 1000 ppi class are not permitted for Type-4 record's.
member.remarks: Native scanning resolution should be set to 0, if no Type-3 through Type-7 records are in the template. Otherwise value must be not 0. Starting from Antemplate.Version50 only for Type-4 record native scanning resolution is mandatory as not 0 value.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.NativeScanningResolutionPpi
member.summary: Sets native scanning resolution in pixels per inch.
member.value: Number containing native scanning resolution in pixels per inch.
member.remarks: Native scanning resolution should be set to 0, if no Type-3 through Type-7 records are in the template. Otherwise value must be not 0. Starting from Antemplate.Version50 only for Type-4 record native scanning resolution is mandatory as not 0 value.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.NominalTransmittingResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets nominal transmitting resolution.
member.value: Number containing nominal transmitting resolution in pixels per millimeter x 1000. Starting from Antemplate.Version50 only values of the 500 ppi class (+-2% tolerance) are permitted for Type-4 records.
member.remarks: Nominal transmitting resolution should be set to 0, if no Type-3 through Type-7 records are in the template. Otherwise value must be not 0. Starting from Antemplate.Version50 only for Type-4 record nominal transmitting resolution is mandatory as not 0 value.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType1Record.NominalTransmittingResolutionPpi
member.summary: Sets nominal transmitting resolution in pixels per inch.
member.value: Number containing nominal transmitting resolution in pixels per inch. Starting from Antemplate.Version50 only values of the 500 ppi class (+-2% tolerance) are permitted for Type-4 records.
member.remarks: Nominal transmitting resolution should be set to 0, if no Type-3 through Type-7 records are in the template. Otherwise value must not be 0. Starting from Antemplate.Version50 only for Type-4 record nominal transmitting resolution is mandatory as not 0 value.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType20Record
member.summary: Provides functionality for working with source representation record. Type-20 records are used to contain images/video file or other signal from which other Record Types are derived. One Type-20 record may be used to derive one or more representations in other biometric records. One of the Type-20 record examples may be group photo from which subject's face is segment and image is stored in Type-10 record.

member.param: Acquisition source type as enum value.
Analog to digital conversion, required when acquisition source type is analog, and the data is stored in digital format.
Radio transmission format description, required when acquisition source type is "RadioTransmissionShortWave" or "RadioTransmissionAmateurRadio".
Acquisition special characteristics for description of any specific conditions not mentioned in the table.
member.returns: Number of acquisition source in AcquisitionSourceCollection.

members.member: Defines CAR field number. Field referenced by this number contains the srn cardinality.
Defines AQS field number. Field referenced by this number contains the acquisition source(s).
Defines SFT field number. Field referenced by this number contains the source representation format.
Defines SEG field number. Field referenced by this number contains the segment(s).
Defines SHPS field number. Field referenced by this number contains the scanned horizontal pixel scale.
Defines SVPS field number. Field referenced by this number contains the scanned vertical pixel scale.
Defines TIX field number. Field referenced by this number contains the time index.
Defines SRN field number. Field referenced by this number contains the source representation number.
Defines ICDR field number. Field referenced by this number contains the imagery capture date range estimate.
Defines maximal acquisition source count of field referenced by FieldAqs field number.
Defines minimal acquisition source analog to digital conversion value length of field referenced by FieldAqs field number.
Defines maximal acquisition source analog to digital conversion value length of field referenced by FieldAqs field number.
Defines minimal acquisition source radio transmission format value length of field referenced by FieldAqs field number.
Defines maximal acquisition source radio transmission format value length of field referenced by FieldAqs field number.
Defines minimal acquisition source special characteristics value length of field referenced by FieldAqs field number.
Defines maximal acquisition source special characteristics value length of field referenced by FieldAqs field number.
Defines minimal value of field referenced by FieldSrn field number.
Defines maximal value of field referenced by FieldSrn field number.
Defines maximal value length of field referenced by FieldSrn field number.
Defines minimal segment count of field referenced by FieldSeg field number.
Defines maximal segment count of field referenced by FieldSeg field number.
Defines minimal segment vertex count of field referenced by FieldSeg field number.
Defines maximal segment vertex count of field referenced by FieldSeg field number.
Defines minimal segment internal file pointer value length of field referenced by FieldSeg field number.
Defines maximal segment internal file pointer value length of field referenced by FieldSeg field number.

members.member: Defines MDI field number. Field referenced by this number contains medical device information.
Defines AFT field number. Field referenced by this number contains associated context format.
Defines SEG field number. Field referenced by this number contains the segment(s).
Defines TIX field number. Field referenced by this number contains the time index.
Defines COM field number. Field referenced by this number contains the comment as free text.
Defines ACN field number. Field referenced by this number contains the associated context number.
Defines ICDR field number. Field referenced by this number contains the imagery capture date range estimate.
Defines minimal medical device information value length of field referenced by FieldMdi field number.
Defines maximal medical device information value length of field referenced by FieldMdi field number.
Defines minimal value of field referenced by FieldAcn field number.
Defines maximal value of field referenced by FieldAcn field number.
Defines maximal value length of field referenced by FieldAcn field number.
Defines minimal segment count of field referenced by FieldSeg field number.
Defines maximal segment count of field referenced by FieldSeg field number.
Defines minimal segment vertex count of field referenced by FieldSeg field number.
Defines maximal segment vertex count of field referenced by FieldSeg field number.
Defines minimal segment internal file pointer value length of field referenced by FieldSeg field number.
Defines maximal segment internal file pointer value length of field referenced by FieldSeg field number.
Defines maximal comment value length of field referenced by FieldCom field number.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSignatureType
member.summary: Represents signature type values.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSignatureType.Subject
member.summary: This field contains a binary "0" for the signature image of the subject.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSignatureType.Official
member.summary: The signature image value of the official processing the transaction.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSignatureRepresentationType
member.summary: Represents Signature representation type (SRT).

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSignatureRepresentationType.ScannedUncompressed
member.summary: Indicates that record contains the uncompressed scanned binary image data for the signature. In uncompressed mode, the data shall be packed at eight pixels per byte.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSignatureRepresentationType.ScannedCompressed
member.summary: Indicates that record contains the scanned binary image data for the signature in compressed form using the ANSI/EIA-538-1988 facsimile compression algorithm.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSignatureRepresentationType.VectorData
member.summary: Indicates that record contains a list of vectors describing the pen position and pen pressure of line segments within the signature. Each vector consists of five bytes.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANPenVector
member.summary: Specifies a list of vectors describing the pen position and pen pressure of line segments within the signature.

remarks.paraattr:
Both the X and Y coordinates shall be expressed in units of .0254 mm (.001 inches) referenced from the bottom leftmost corner of the signature. Positive values of X shall increase from left-to-right and positive values of Y shall increase from bottom-to-top.
An unsigned binary number between "0" and "255" represents the pen pressure. This shall be a constant pressure until the next vector becomes active. A binary value or pressure of "0" shall represent a "pen-up" (or no pressure) condition. The binary value of "1" shall represent the least recordable pressure for a particular device, while the binary equivalent of "254" shall represent the maximum recordable pressure for that device. To denote the end of the vector list the binary equivalent of "255" shall be inserted in this entry.

member.summary: Defines the native type of the object.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ANType8Record class.
member.param: Specifies the version of the ANType8Record.

Image scanning resolution flag.
Up to ANTemplate.Version40, the value was:false if half the minimum scanning resolution is used and true if half the native scanning resolution is used.
From ANTemplate.Version50, the value are: false if the scanned and transmitted image resolution is of the 500 ppi class (+-1% tolerance) and true is otherwise.

member.name: M:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType8Record.#ctor(Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSignatureType,Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANSignatureRepresentationType,System.Boolean,Neurotec.Images.NImage)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ANType8Record class with current version and unset IDC value.
member.param:
Image scanning resolution flag.
Up to ANTemplate.Version40, the value was:false if half the minimum scanning resolution is used and true if half the native scanning resolution is used.
From ANTemplate.Version50, the value are: false if the scanned and transmitted image resolution is of the 500 ppi class (+-1% tolerance) and true is otherwise.
member.remarks: ANRecord's version is set the same as ANTemplate.VersionCurrent. If IDC is NOT set, then IDC value is automatically assigned when ANRecord is added to ANTemplate.
