member.summary: Represent collection of biometric data quality scores.

members.member: Defines BCD field number. Field referenced by this number contains the date that the biometric sample was captured.
Defines HDV field number. Field referenced by this number contains the version of CBEFF specification that this record conforms.
Defines BFY field number. Field referenced by this number contains the type of biometric technology used.
Defines BDQ field number. Field referenced by this number contains quality score data for the biometric data stored in the BDB field of this record.
Defines BFO field number. Field referenced by this number contains the vendor, standards body, working group, or industry consortium that has defined the format of the biometric data (in the BDB).
Defines BFT field number. Field referenced by this number contains the value assigned by the format owner to represent the specific BDB format as specified by the format owner.
Defines BDB field number. Field referenced by this number contains the CBEFF Biometric Data Block.
Defines maximum number of biometric data quality metric.
Defines maximum number of biometric data quality metric for version 5.0 and above.

members.member: Defines older version of CBEFF specification.

member.name: M:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANFPMinutia.#ctor(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt16,System.Byte,Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.BdifFPMinutiaType)
member.summary: Initializes new instance of ANFPMinutia structure.
member.param: Angle between the horizontal axis of the coordinate system and the direction that a ridge ending points. Angle is in degrees.

Minutiae quality measure value. Values shall range from "0" to "63". The value "0" shall indicate a manually encoded minutia. The value "1" shall indicate that no method of indicating a confidence level is available. Values between "2" and "63" shall indicate decreasing levels of confidence, with "2" meaning the greatest confidence.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType9Record
member.summary: Provides functions for working with Minutiae data record.
member.remarks: Starting from version 5.0, Type-9 record do not maintain standard minutiae data fields (although they are supported as 'legacy fields'). Vendor-defined data blocks should be used for minutiae data storing (please check ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2011 standard for all defined vendor blocks). Neurotec SDK provides high level API functions for minutiae data storing in 'INCITS 378' vendor data block (defined by ANSI INCITS 378 standard) as well supports 'Other feature sets' data block for storing minutiae data in proprietary format (if it is required). 'INCITS 378' data block is implemented by providing ability to set/get and validate data in this block. Other vendor-defined data blocks could be used by operating with low level API functions to manipulate records fields values. Therefore Neurotec SDK do not provide validation for these vendor-defined data blocks.

members.member: Defines the starting filed of a common block of tagged fields.
Defines the ending filed number of a common block of tagged fields.
Defines IMP field number. Field referenced by this number contains impression type (IMP) value.
Defines FMT field number. Field referenced by this number contains minutiae format (FMT) value.
Defines the starting filed of a standard format features block.
Defines the ending filed of a standard format features block.
Defines OFR field number. Field referenced by this number contains originating fingerprint reading system (OFR) value.
Defines FGP field number. Field referenced by this number contains finger position (FGP) value.
Defines FPC field number. Field referenced by this number contains fingerprint pattern classification (FPC) value.
Defines CRP field number. Field referenced by this number contains core position (CRP) value.
Defines DLT field number. Field referenced by this number contains delta(s) position (DLT).
Defines MIN field number. Field referenced by this number contains number of minutiae (MIN)
Defines RDG field number. Field referenced by this number contains minutiae ridge count indicator (RDG) value.
Defines MRC field number. Field referenced by this number contains minutiae and ridge count data (MRC).
Defines CBI field number. Field referenced by this number contains M1 CBEFF information (CBI).
Defines CEI field number. Field referenced by this number contains M1 capture equipment identification (CEI).
Defines HLL field number. Field referenced by this number contains M1 horizontal line length (HLL).
Defines VLL field number. Field referenced by this number contains M1 vertical line length (VLL).
Defines SLC field number. Field referenced by this number contains M1 scale units (SLC).
Defines THPS field number. Field referenced by this number contains M1 transmitted horizontal pixel scale (THPS).
Defines TVPS field number. Field referenced by this number contains M1 transmitted vertical pixel scale (TVPS).
Defines FVW field number. Field referenced by this number contains M1 finger view (FVW).
Defines FGP field number. Field referenced by this number contains M1 friction ridge generalized position (FGP).
Defines FQD field number. Field referenced by this number contains M1 friction ridge quality data (FQD).
Defines NOM field number. Field referenced by this number contains M1 number of minutiae (NOM).
Defines FMD field number. Field referenced by this number contains M1 finger minutiae data (FMD).
Defines RCI field number. Field referenced by this number contains M1 ridge count information (RCI).
Defines CIN field number. Field referenced by this number contains M1 core information (CIN).
Defines DIN field number. Field referenced by this number contains M1 delta information (DIN).
Defines ADA field number. Field referenced by this number contains M1 additional delta angles (ADA).
Defines OOD field number. Field referenced by this number contains other feature sets - owner or developer (OOD).
Defines PAG field number. Field referenced by this number contains other feature sets - processing algorithm (PAG).
Defines SOD field number. Field referenced by this number contains other feature sets - system or device (SOD).
Defines DTX field number. Field referenced by this number contains other feature sets - contact information (DTX).
Defines ULA field number. Field referenced by this number contains universal latent workstation annotation information (ULA).
Defines ANN field number. Field referenced by this number contains annotation information (ANN).
Defines DUI field number. Field referenced by this number contains the device or source of the data.
Defines MMS field number. Field referenced by this number contains make, model and serial number for the image capture device.
Defines the starting filed of a vendor defined features block.
Defines the ending filed of a vendor defined features block.
Defines the ending filed of a vendor defined features block starting from version 5.0.
Defines maximum fingerprint X coordinate.
Defines maximum fingerprint Y coordinate.
Defines maximum palmprint X coordinate.
Defines maximum palmprint Y coordinate.
Defines that minutia has been encoded manually.
Defines that no method of indicating a confidence level is available.
Defines greatest confidence in minutia quality.
Defines worst confidence in minutia quality.
Defines Cbeff format owner for 'INCITS 378' data block. Cbeff Onwer is set as INCITS Technical Committee M1.
Defines minimal line length value in pixels for HLL and VLL in 'INCITS 378' data block.
Defines maximal line length value in pixels for HLL and VLL in 'INCITS 378' data block.
Defines minimal minutiae count in 'INCITS 378' data block of field referenced by FieldM1Fmd field number.
Defines minimal ridge count information's count in 'INCITS 378' data block of field referenced by FieldM1Rci field number for version 5.0.
Defines maximal ridge count information's count in 'INCITS 378' data block of field referenced by FieldM1Rci field number.
Defines maximal cores count in 'INCITS 378' data block of field referenced by FieldM1Cin field number.
Defines maximal deltas count in 'INCITS 378' data block of fields referenced by FieldM1Din and FieldM1Ada field numbers.
Defines minimal value length of field referenced by FieldUla field number.
Defines maximal value length of field referenced by FieldUla field number.
Defines maximal value length of field referenced by FieldOod field number.
Defines maximal processing algorithm name value length of field referenced by FieldPag field number.
Defines maximal processing algorithm version value length of field referenced by FieldPag field number.
Defines maximal system name value length of field referenced by FieldSod field number.
Defines maximal system version value length of field referenced by FieldSod field number.
Defines maximal value length of field referenced by FieldDtx field number.
Defines Neurotec owner of the other feature set referenced by FieldOod field number.
Defines the flag indicating whether ridge counts should be skipped while setting FMRecord.
Defines the flag indicating whether singular points (cores and deltas) should be skipped while setting FMRecord.
Defines the flag indicating whether singular points (cores and deltas) should be skipped while setting FMRecord.

member.name: M:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType9Record.#ctor(Neurotec.NVersion,System.Int32,System.Boolean,Neurotec.Biometrics.NFRecord)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ANType9Record class.
member.param: Specifies the version of the FMRecord.
[in] Minutiae format flag value. true if minutiae format is standard false otherwise.
member.remarks: If minutiae format flag is true, the Type-9 record is created with standard minutiae data for Type-9 record. These fields are not recomended to use from version 5.0, as it is only supported as legacy fields. If minutiae format flag is false, then vendor specific block "INCITS 378" is filled with data from NFRecord.

member.name: M:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType9Record.#ctor(Neurotec.NVersion,System.Int32,System.Boolean,Neurotec.Biometrics.NFRecord,System.UInt32)

member.remarks: If minutiae format flag is true, the Type-9 record is created with standard minutiae data for Type-9 record. These fields are not recomended to use from version 5.0, as it is only supported as legacy fields. If minutiae format flag is false, then vendor specific block "INCITS 378" is filled with data from NFRecord.

member.name: M:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType9Record.SetFMRecord(Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.FMRecord,System.Byte,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Fills 'Incits 378' and 'Other feature sets' data blocks with data from FMRecord. 'Incits 378' data block is filled with standard data from FMRecord. Neurotec proprietary data is set in 'Other feature sets' data block. If Neurotec proprietary data should not be set, the FlagSkipNeurotecFields should be used. This method is available from version 5.0.
member.param: FMRecord containing minutiae data according to ANSI INCITS 378 standard.
Index, indicating which FmrFingerView object from FMRecord should be set to Type-9 record.
Bitwise combination of zero or more flags that controls behavior of the method.
member.remarks: The following flags are supported: FlagSkipRidgeCounts, FlagSkipSingularPoints, FlagSkipNeurotecFields.

member.name: M:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.ANType9Record.SetFMRecord(Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.FMRecord,System.Byte)
member.summary: Fills 'Incits 378' data block with data from FMRecord. This method is available from version 5.0.
member.param: FMRecord containing minutiae data according to ANSI INCITS 378 standard.
Index, indicating which FmrFingerView object from FMRecord should be set to Type-9 record.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.Standards.CbeffBdbFormatIdentifiers
member.summary: Specifies CBEFF Biometric Data Block (BDB) Format identifiers registered with International Biometric Industry Association (IBIA).

members.member: The CBEFF BDB format identifier assigned to INCITS Technical Committee M1 - Biometrics Finger Minutiae format - no extended data.
The CBEFF BDB format identifier assigned to INCITS Technical Committee M1 - Biometrics Finger Minutiae Format - with extended data.
The CBEFF BDB format identifier assigned to INCITS Technical Committee M1 - Biometrics Finger Minutiae format - presence of extended data unspecified.
The CBEFF BDB format identifier assigned to INCITS Technical Committee M1 - Biometrics Finger Pattern format - no extended data.
The CBEFF BDB format identifier assigned to INCITS Technical Committee M1 - Biometrics Finger Image format.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NBiometric.CaptureOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the biometric capture options.

remarks.paraattr:
Manual capture: does face detection from stream until NBiometricClient.Force/ForceStart is called, then does extraction or other required operations. Used only when performing capture operation (from camera or video file).
Stream capture: creates face template from multiple images. Used with capture operation or extraction from video file.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NBiometric.Status
member.summary: Gets or sets the biometric status.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NBiometric.HasMoreSamples
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the NBioemtric object has more samples.
member.remarks: Property is used for operations (stream extraction / detection) requiring multiple samples (images) to complete. When set to true engine starts/continues stream extraction for each time task is performed. Changing Image does not clear NLAttributes when property is set to true. Set to false when operation completed (face status != none), or when end of stream/images.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.NBiometricEngine
member.summary: Provides main biometric engine functionality.

remarks.paraattr: Most biometric methods in the engine return NBiometricStatus, which contains the information about the operation status. Actual result of the method is stored within NMatchingResult within the provided NSubject object. Asynchronous methods (i.e. with Async postfix) return instantly and return an object (IAsyncResult) which allows to wait until the completion of the operation. The returned IAsyncResult object may also contain the biometric status, like a non-asynchronous function; the biometric status in asynchronous methods is returned when the method is completed (i.e. in methods with End postfix).

A user-defined object that qualifies or contains information about an asynchronous operation.
member.returns: IAsyncResult object which allows to complete the operation.

member.summary: The biometric engine completes asynchronously detecting faces in the specified image.

member.returns: The NFace object containing the information about the detected faces.

member.summary: Checks or sets whether a thumbnail face image should be created.
member.value: true if a thumbnail face image should be created; else false.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NBiometricEngine.FacesThumbnailImageWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets thumbnail face image width.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NBiometricEngine.FacesMinimalInterOcularDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum distance between eyes in face.
member.value: The identifier of type N_TYPE_INT specifying minimum distance between eyes in face. Faces which have smaller distance between eyes than this parameter, won't be returned by the face detection routines. Must be in range [10..10000].
member.remarks: If MinIOD and/or MaxIOD will be set very similar to the real distance between the eyes, it could cause to not so accurate results (of face detection). When the face is set MinIOD and MaxIOD the face could be found up to ~1.5 times bigger/smaller value it is set.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NBiometricEngine.FacesConfidenceThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets face detection confidence threshold.
member.value: Specifies the threshold which is considered when looking for faces in an image. For each face candidate confidence parameter is calculated. With higher threshold value faces are selected more strictly by the face detection routines. Must be in range [0..100].

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NBiometricEngine.FacesMaximalRoll
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum face roll angle deviation.
member.value: Defines maximum roll angle deviation from frontal face in degrees which is considered when looking for faces in an image. Must be in range [0..180]. Parameter type - float.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NBiometricEngine.FacesMaximalYaw
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum face yaw angle deviation.
member.value: Identifier specifying the maximum yaw angle deviation from frontal face in degrees. The value of this parameter can be in range [0..90]. The default value is 15. Currently supports deviations up to 45 degrees.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NBiometricEngine.FacesDetectAllFeaturePoints
member.summary: Gets or sets whether all face feature points should be detected.
member.value: Identifier specifying whether all facial feature points should be detected. If the value is NFalse, only centers of eyes or base facial features are detected, otherwise all supported facial feature points are detected. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NBiometricEngine.FacesDetectBaseFeaturePoints
member.summary: Gets or sets whether face base feature points should be detected.
member.value: Identifier specifying whether base facial feature points should be detected during facial feature detection. Currently, base facial feature points are: center of right eye, center of left eye, nose tip and center of mouth. The default value is false.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMFusionType.FuseAlways
member.summary: Always matches fingerprints, palmprints, faces and irises. The results of are fused.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMFusionType.SelectByFaceThenFuse
member.summary: Matches faces. If the result is greater than ParameterFacesMatchingThresholdNew, then matches fingerprints, palms and irises also and fuses results; otherwise, score is zero.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NMFusionType.SelectByIrisThenFuse
member.summary: Matches irises. If the result is greater than ParameterIrisesMatchingThreshold, then matches fingerprints, palms and faces also and fuses results; otherwise, score is zero.

members.member: Enumerates biometric status values. These values are returned by NBiometricDevice.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NBiometricStatus.None
member.paraattr: Indicates that device is performing a concrete operation and can not return status value. Ex., fingerprint is swiped on a fingerprint scanner (operation is not finished yet and NBiometricDevice can not return any other value than None).

members.member: Indicates succeeded operation.
Indicates canceled operation.
Indicates that operation timed-out.
Indicates that NFace or NFinger was not set with the image or capture device was not set for capture operation. Indicates that biometric device should be cleaned.

Indicates that object(s) was not removed after/before NBiometricDevice finished/started capturing process, usually it is returned when finger is placed on fingerprint scanner sensor before capturing operation is started.
Indicates that object was marked as missing e.g. when you capture 4 fingerprints and you set one of them as missing (that NFinger will have this status), then scanner will expect only 3 fingers.
Indicates that object(s) (e.g. face or iris) was not found – object(s) is found if it passes Confidence Threshold value.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NBiometricStatus.TooFewObjects
member.paraattr: Indicates that too few objects was provided for device to succeed its operation. Ex., not enough fingerprints were scanned.

members.member: Indicates that too many objects were provided for NBiometricDevice to perform operation.
Indicates sequence of bad object(s).
Indicates that spoof object was detected.
Indicates bad object (quality of detected object is lower than Quality Threshold).
Indicates that dynamic range of image is bad.
Indicates bad exposure (e.g. too low light).
Indicates that image is too sharpen or too blurred.
Indicates that image is too noisy.
Indicates bad contrast.
Indicates that there are too few features to be extracted (e.g. fingerprint has less minutiaes than minimum number or voice recording is too short).
Indicates that fingerprint was placed too soft on a device.
Indicates that fingerprint was placed too hard on a device.
Indicates bad fingerprint position.
Indicated that object was too north from device.
Indicated that object was too east from device.
Indicated that object was too south from device.
Indicated that object was too west from device.
Indicated that object was too close to device.
Indicated that object was too far from device.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NBiometricStatus.BadSpeed
member.paraattr: Indicates too slow/fast moving object during operation. Ex., fingerprint was swiped too slow (too fast) when fingerprint scanning operation was performed on a scanner.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NBiometricStatus.TooSlow
member.paraattr: Indicates that object was moving too slow. Ex., fingerprint was swiped through scanner too slow.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NBiometricStatus.TooFast
member.paraattr: Indicates that object was moving too fast. Ex., fingerprint was swiped through scanner too fast.

members.member: Indicates object's bad size.
Indicates that object is too short for NBiometricDevice to perform operation.
Indicates that object is too long for NBiometricDevice to perform operation.
Indicates that object is too narrow for NBiometricDevice to perform operation.
Indicates that object is too wide for NBiometricDevice to perform operation.
Indicates that object is too skewed.
Indicates that object was moving to wrong direction.
Indicates that the wrong hand was used. Indicates that some samples are mutually incompatible.
Indicates that samples are incompatible i.e. images used for generalization are not of the same size.
Indicates that source was not found i.e. image path set to NFace, NFinger, etc. does not exist.
Indicates that file set as an image to NFace, NFinger, etc. object is not an image or is of the format which is not supported.
NSubject with specified Id value was not found.
The Id specified in NSubject already exists in the database.
Match was not found.
Indicates that duplicate was found.
Indicates conflict.
Indicates that operation is not possible for the object.
Indicates invalid Id value i.e. signs “?”, “!” are not allowed in Id.
Query specified in the NSubject cannot be executed.
Indicates invalid property value.
Indicates invalid field value.
Indicates that image resolution is not set or is set with value lower than 250.
Indicates that operation cannot be use with that object.
Indicates that functionality is not enabled, as required licenses were not obtained.
Indicates that error happened during video file or stream reading.
Indicates capture error.
Indicates communication error.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutia.X
member.summary: Gets or sets x coordinate of the minutia.
member.value: The X coordinate of the minutia.
member.remarks: The x coordinate of the minutia is specified in pixels at resolution and "X * [NFRecord horizontal resolution] / Resolution" cannot be greater than MaxDimension or NFRecord width minus one.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutia.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets y coordinate of the minutia.
member.value: The Y coordinate of the minutia.
member.remarks: The y coordinate of the minutia is specified in pixels at resolution and "Y * [NFRecord vertical resolution] / Resolution" cannot be greater than MaxDimension or NFRecord width minus one.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutia.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the minutia.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutia.RawAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the raw angle of the minutia.
member.value: The raw angle of the minutia.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutia.Angle
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle of the minutia.
member.remarks: The angle of the minutia is specified in 180/128 degrees units in counterclockwise order and cannot be greater than 256 minus one.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutia.Quality
member.summary: Gets or sets quality of the minutia.
member.remarks: The quality of the minutia must be in the range [0, 100].The higher it is, the better the quality of the minutia is. If quality of the minutia is unknown it must be set to zero.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutia.Curvature
member.summary: Gets or sets the ridge curvature near minutia.
member.remarks: If curvature of the minutia is unknown it must be set to 255.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutia.G
member.summary: Gets or sets the G (ridge density) near minutia.
member.remarks: If G of the minutia is unknown it must be set to 255.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFRidgeCountsType
member.summary: Specifies type of ridge counts contained in NFRecord.
member.remarks: Extracted template with EightNeighborsWithIndexes parameter is bigger than the template extracted with EightNeighbors parameter. Templates extracted with EightNeighborsWithIndexes parameter is faster than the templates extracted with EightNeighbors parameter. Extracted template with FourNeighborsWithIndexes parameter is bigger than the template extracted with FourNeighbors parameter. Templates extracted with FourNeighborsWithIndexes parameter is faster than the templates extracted with FourNeighbors parameter.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFRidgeCountsType.None
member.summary: The NFRecord does not contain ridge counts.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFRidgeCountsType.FourNeighbors
member.summary: The NFRecord contains ridge counts to closest minutia in each of the four sectors of each minutia. First sector starts at minutia angle.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFRidgeCountsType.EightNeighbors
member.summary: The NFRecord contains ridge counts to closest minutia in each of the eight sectors of each minutia. First sector starts at minutia angle.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFRidgeCountsType.FourNeighborsWithIndexes
member.summary: The NFRecord contains ridge counts to four neighbors of each minutia.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFRidgeCountsType.EightNeighborsWithIndexes
member.summary: The NFRecord contains ridge counts to eight neighbors of each minutia.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFRidgeCountsType.Unspecified
member.summary: For internal use.

member.remarks: The x coordinate of the delta is specified in pixels at resolution and "X * [NFRecord horizontal resolution] / Resolution" cannot be greater than MaxDimension or NFRecord width minus one.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFDelta.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets y coordinate of delta.
member.value: The x coordinate of the delta.
member.remarks: The y coordinate of the delta is specified in pixels at resolution and "Y * [NFRecord vertical resolution] / Resolution" cannot be greater than MaxDimension or NFRecord width minus one.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFDelta.RawAngle1
member.summary: Gets or sets the first row angle of the delta.
member.value: The first raw angle of the delta.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFDelta.Angle1
member.summary: Gets or sets the first angle of delta.
member.value: The first angle of the delta.
member.remarks: The angle of the delta is specified in 180/128 degrees units in counterclockwise order and cannot be less than zero or greater than 256 minus one. The value of -1 can be specified if the first angle of the delta is unknown.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFDelta.RawAngle2
member.summary: Gets or sets the second row angle of the delta.
member.value: The second raw angle of the delta.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFDelta.Angle2
member.summary: Gets or sets the second angle of delta.
member.value: The second angle of the delta.
member.remarks: The angle of the delta is specified in 180/128 degrees units in counterclockwise order and cannot be less than zero or greater than 256 minus one. The value of -1 can be specified if the first angle of the delta is unknown.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFDelta.RawAngle3
member.summary: Gets or sets the third row angle of the delta.
member.value: The third raw angle fog the delta.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFDelta.Angle3
member.summary: Gets or sets the third angle of delta.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLivenessMode.None
member.summary: No liveness check is performed.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLivenessMode.Passive
member.summary: User should passively stand still in front of the camera. It takes several seconds to measure the liveness signal.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLivenessMode.Active
member.summary: User should perform several actions to prove his liveness.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLivenessMode.PassiveAndActive
member.summary: A sequence of passive and active liveness detection modes. Active mode is used only if passive mode fails.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLivenessMode.Simple
member.summary: User should turn his head left and right to prove his liveness.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NLivenessMode.Custom
member.summary: Customizable liveness action sequence. By default requires user to turn head according to instructions.

member.name: P:Neurotec.Biometrics.NEAttributes.GrayScaleUtilisation
member.summary: Gets or sets grayscale utilisation value.
member.value: Grayscale utilisation examines pixel values of an iris image for evidence of a spread of intensity values in iris portion of the image. A useful iris image should have a dynamic range of 256 grey levels, allocating at least 8 bits with a minimum of 6 bits of useful information. An “underexposed” image would have too few high intensity pixels, and conversely for “overexposed”. An image with a high score indicates a properly exposed image, with a wide, well distributed spread of intensity values.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutiaOrder
member.summary: Specifies minutia order.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutiaOrder.None
member.summary: Specifies that minutiae are not sorted.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutiaOrder.Ascending
member.summary: Specifies that minutiae are sorted ascending by the specified order.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutiaOrder.Descending
member.summary: Specifies that minutiae are sorted descending by the specified order.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutiaOrder.CartesianXY
member.summary: Specifies that minutiae are sorted by X field. If X field of two minutiae are equal Y field is compared.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutiaOrder.CartesianYX
member.summary: Specifies that minutiae are sorted by Y field. If Y field of two minutiae are equal X field is compared.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutiaOrder.Angle
member.summary: Specifies that minutiae are sorted by Angle field.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutiaOrder.Polar
member.summary: Specifies that minutiae are sorted by distance from minutiae center of mass. If distance of two minutiae are equal Angle field is compared.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutiaOrder.Quality
member.summary: Specifies that minutiae are sorted by quality.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutiaOrder.Matching
member.summary: Specifies that minutiae are sorted by matching.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutiaTruncationAlgorithm
member.summary: Specifies minutiae truncation algorithm.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutiaTruncationAlgorithm.ConvexHull
member.summary: Specifies the minutiae truncation algorithm by peeling off minutiae from the convex hull as defined in Iso 19794-2:2005 standard.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutiaTruncationAlgorithm.CenterOfMass
member.summary: Specifies the minutiae truncation algorithm by minutia Euclidean distance to center of mass as defined in Iso 19794-2:2011 standard.

member.name: F:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFMinutiaTruncationAlgorithm.QualityAndCenterOfMass
member.summary: Specifies the minutiae truncation algorithm by minutia quality and Euclidean distance to center of mass as defined in Iso 19794-2:2011 standard.

member.name: M:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFRecord.GetPatternClass(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Retrieves fingerprint pattern class from packed NFRecord.
member.param: The byte array of packed NFRecord.
member.remarks:
\1. This function supports both NFRecord version 1.0 and 2.0 formats. Always returns NFPatternClass.Unknown for version 1.0 format.
\2. This method returns NFPatternClass if NFPatternClass was set using PatternClass.
\3. Classify can be used for classification.

member.name: M:Neurotec.Biometrics.NFRecord.GetPatternClass(Neurotec.IO.NBuffer)
member.summary: Retrieves fingerprint pattern class from packed NFRecord.
member.remarks:
\1. This function supports both NFRecord version 1.0 and 2.0 formats. Always returns NFPatternClass.Unknown for version 1.0 format.
\2. This method returns NFPatternClass if NFPatternClass was set using PatternClass.
\3. Classify can be used for classification.

member.name: T:Neurotec.Biometrics.NSubject
